description: Brief arriving in October.

comments.value: Brief arriving in October.
Morag, have you got an update on the doubleclick stuff?
Not yet – let me chase!

Not yet – we should have clarity by the end of the week though.

In the meantime, please find attached a design showing the three ad placements we are looking at:

1. Leaderboard header on top of all templates – standard ad size

2. Right hand column of all templates with a right hand column i.e. not home or map templates – two custom ad sizes the same width as our main columns; we would like to server the flexible promo we currently have (the one we have used for Games Maker / Tickets) as well as another identically-sized one underneath)

Does this give you enough to work out what the impact is on templates etc.?

Hope by Thurs we will know what is happening with Double Click too.

Thanks!

This is a very helpful start. Do you know yet whether we are going to be tagging the ads in any way or is it likely to be the same markup in every page?

Also, have we heard anything about doubleclick?

And do you have a timetable that you want us to aim for?
Will fill you in when you are across today!
Any update on this one?
Not yet – to be revived in Jan
Coming soon, but held up by illness!
Just to warn you - this is back on the radar - we are aiming to be live with this by end of June. More to follow!
Hurrah - we finally have our DoubleClick account set up so can proceed. What do you need in order to progress this - access to our Google account?
This should presumably be considered as part of the homepage redesign. #3188

Sorry Danny,

No, lets keep them separate :)

One might have an impact on the other (and it would be silly not to think about one without the other when discussing either) but they are separate pieces of work likely to have different people looking after them both here and at LOCOG.
And also it’s not just the home page – ads will be across every template.
Please can we look at this as a priority? Keen to get this up this month. What do you need from us?

Hi Morag,

Are you going with standard IAB ad sizes? 
http://www.iab.net/iab_products_and_industry_services/1421/1443/1452

Or are you going with sizes that fit the site, the designs / you comments seems to indicate the later but wanted to check, because if you are taking third party / existing ads the non standard sizes will cause issues. If you are are going with non standard sizes you'll need to be very clear to partners what these size are (both vertical and horizontal).

The current right hand column is 220px but a standard skyscraper IMU is 160px wide and a standard 180 x 150 IMU won't fit nicely anywhere on the homepage, where the slots are also all 220px wide.

In terms of moving forward we need:

- the tag code for the new adverts, and if any parameters such as page path, name or metadata fields need setting.
- the exact sizes for the new adverts (height and width) : I assume the top banner is a standard 728 x 90 IMU ?

Before we roll anything out to live we will want to check the top ad down't cause layout issues (ie. by pushing the page down) and we will do this on dev once we have the tag code.

But in terms of migrating to live and checking before we go fully live would it be possible to get the ad server to only serve adverts to specific IP addresses in the first instance, that way we could put the tags in, check they look good and then make them public?

thanks

Jamie
Morag, I think we are waiting for feedback on Jamie's questions on tag codes and sizes.

From: Erin Berger

Subject: RE: Update and Actions from DoubleClick session with Kudah 11th August
 
Hi All,
 
To those that came this afternoon to the meeting with Kudah, thank you. I have provided a review below for everyone and new action points.
 
-          Manual vs Dynamic tag generation

o   This still needs to be discussed with Kitsite, but the view at this stage is that dynamic tag generation is going to be the preference due to the following reason:

§  Easier to implement

§  There will be a communication process requirement via developers – trafficker, in either situation so it makes sense that if in the short time frames that we have to implement this that we go with this process.

-          Iframe vs Javascript

o   Based on conversations with D3, we are going to be use iframes to upload our adverts. The reason being that the ad loading will not impact the page load.

-          Allowing 3rd Party ad Tags

o   We still need to discuss this point with the Partners to understand how important a factor this is. We will focus on this point after we have got the ad serving up and running.

Actions ( in addition to the ones below):
-          Morag to arrange meeting/ call with Kitsite to run through tagging preference and timelines for implementation

-          Erin to set up users in DFP

-          Erin to produce a javascrpt and iframe tag with a test creative for testing by Kitsite and Technology. Erin will send this to Morag by the EOP on Friday

-          Colin/ Aaron/Technology to let us know testing timeline, ideally we will have all the tags implemented by 19th August. Testing could be scheduled w/c 22nd so that we are ready to go live on 1st September

Any questions please let me know.

Thanks
Erin
 
 
Kind Regards
 
Erin Berger

Mobile:  +44 (0) 791 2999557

Subject: RE: Follow up from DoubleClick Training: Action Plan
 
All,

Thank you for your time today, it was very useful and I am glad we are all linked up now.
 
I have listed below the following action points and assigned who is responsible for each one. We need to have everything in place so we can begin serving advertising on the current website by 1st September.
 
Actions Plan
1.      EB to speak to DoubleClick to get clarification/ information on the below ahead of our meeting on Thursday.

a.      Outline the benefits of manual tag generation vs. dynamic

b.      Send over Technical Specification document

c.       If using either java script or an iframe what would appear on the site should there be an error. Is it a 404 message or a blank screen? I am imagining a tag is generated but there is no creative assigned to it. Could we assign a default in-house creative?

d.      Regarding 3rd Party ad tags: From the DoubleClick preferred list of 3rd Party providers, how has DoubleClick selected this list? Have you asked for confirmation that they take certain security process on their platforms to ensure that security issues are minimised?

2.      MR to ask Kitsite if it is ok to point LOCOG CDN at Kitsite demo-site

3.      Once MR receives Technical Specification Document from EB, speak to Kitsite to discuss tagging implementation preference

4.      LG to raise point 2 with D3 tomorrow

5.      EB to generate test code by Friday 12th August for Kitsite to begin testing. EB will send code to MR

6.      w/c 15th August Tag generation Kitsite and EB

7.      w/c 22nd August test the platform for:

a.      Tagging implementation- EB/DM/ Kitsite

b.      Trafficking set up – EB/ DM

c.       Security concerns- Technology Team

d.      Load issues- Technology Team

8.      Tuesday 30th August- EB to traffic really inventory into  platform

9.      Wednesday 31st August final testing

10.  Thursday 1st September – live adverts on site

If I have missed anything please feel free to let me know.
 
Many thanks
Erin
 
Kind Regards
 
Erin Berger
Telephone:  +44 (0) 203 2012 061
Mobile:  +44 (0) 791 2999557
 
 
From: Erin Berger 
Sent: 08 August 2011 10:30
To: Morag Reavley; Liz Goulding; Tom Price-Stephens
Cc: Dipesh Morjaria
Subject: Follow up from DoubleClick Training
 
Good Morning everyone,
 
Thanks for your time on Friday, I thought it was a really productive session and I am really looking forward to us being able to play around with the platform later this week.  
 
Morag, I have asked Kudah to send over any technical documentation that he can today. Also we are going to be doing a follow up session on Thursday 11th, I am not too sure where as yet but I recall the afternoon was best. Kudah said he could spend some extra time with you Morag if you feel it is necessary.
 
I feel that there a some key points raised on Friday that we need to address urgently amongst ourselves and also with technology. I have listed them below.
Tagging
-          Now that we have seen what is involved in generating the tags across two levels, we need to really review the sitemap and determine who we approach the tagging.

W    Questions to consider:

·         Do we do it dynamically or manually

·         Pro for dynamically- a lot simpler to implement.

·         Con more risk- if the sitemap changes then there needs to be a new tag generated. More communication required between developers and trafficker.

-         3rd party Tags

        There may be a requirement to allow 3rd Part tags; they allow Partners the flexibility to change creative on their side without going through LOCOG. All creative would have to be pre-approved. I do appreciate however that there may be some concerns around security from technology around this offering. We need to gather a list of approved 3rd Party tag suppliers from Kudah and then discuss this with Technology.

 
iFrames
        We discussed using iFrames for the ad slots. The feedback from DoubleClick was that, as we are not offering any expandable ad slots then it would be recommended to use iframes as they do not impact the loading of the page as the ad loads separately in the iframe. Is everyone in agreement that we use iframes?  From a implementation point of view it seems straight forward that you just select iFrame when we generate the tags.

I will put some time in everyone’s calendar to review this ahead of our catch up with Kudah on Thursday.  I would really like to have someone from Technology there to have their input, is there a contact I could invite?

Many thanks

Erin

 
 
Erin Berger
 
Digital Media Project Manager

Mobile:  +44 (0) 791 2999557
 
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games Ltd
One Churchill Place
Canary Wharf
London E14 5LN
london2012.com
Did you get the code okay?
Yep, got it fine..

Please find attached a sitemap showing how we propose to breakdown the site.

Basically we’ll aim to drill down to level 2 and 3 functionality in terms of sub-section granularity.

Will you just pull through the exact section paths into the pages? The person managing the Double Click system for the Commercial team wanted to see if there is any way to use a shortform for the purposes of matching sections to tag names. E.g. would you ever abbreviate names for e.g. getinvolvednow_jobs/whyworkforlondon2012?

If we could see something in dev tomorrow that would be a very good starting point so we can see how where the challenges are going to be.

We are still very keen to meet the 1 September go-live date. Are you able to put together a timeline based around this date?

Many thanks!

Hi Morag, can you attach the tags from your previous email to this ticket?

I rather stupidly uploaded a file from my destop called tags, which was something completely unrelated !
Done!

Morag, appologies just realised this tag approach isn't going to work, we cant generate specific tags per section like this (at least not in the timescales mentioned, we'll be pushed to get even the most basic tags in place and tested is month).

Is there anyway to use a tag/parameter that simply takes a path parameter ie /foo/bar/filename.php ?

Read my last comment as well, but..

If it helps we can pull out the 1st, 2nd or third level section names, although given that some key sections are already 2 levels deep not all level 3 sections have equal weight.

/lowercase_section_name/sub_section_name would be the easier to pass in as we already have that info to hand, we Lao know if a page is an index or hub page.

We can also pass in any tags that are already on the page, but bear in mind that we can't easily do cascading of tags and so each page would need to be tagged. But I think this approach would only work for the cases where you needed to pass in 'additional' tags, not for the basic way of letting q tag know where it is in the site.

Reminder to self re. what needs to be deployed when we roll this out to live CMS 1) DoubleClick package 2) CSS padding rules https://dev.kitsite.com/kit/coder/css/main.css #leaderboard_ad { padding-bottom: 20px; } #mpu_ad { padding-bottom: 20px; } 3) All the Master templates need a leaderboard and rhs tag.
4) In addition all templates that extend 'sidebar-right-2012' need a RHS added to the template.

NOT PROTECTIVELY MARKED Hi Jamie After speaking with my colleague and having another play around on the publication editor you've set up, I've realised that we cannot select multiple themes using the drop down system. Lots of the reports are relevant to more than one theme, so we would like to be able to select all the themes (and sub themes) they are relevant to. I was initially envisaging that this would be a check-box system, but could we just amend the drop down menu so that you can select more than one theme using the Ctrl button? I'm really sorry about this, I thought that I had made this clear in the brief, and the implications of a drop down menu system have only just occurred to me. Could you give me a call so that we can talk this through? subject: Paralympic Ticketing app
description:
From: Fiona McLaren <Fiona.McLaren@london2012.com>

Just wanted to get in touch as we’ve just started work on a Paralympic
ticketing app with Polymath. In much the same way as with Torch and
the 1 year to go stuff, we’d like to host this on our site, within a
blank template page.

I’ve attached the full spec and timelines that we are working to.
Hopefully there won’t be too much to do on your side, but to ensure
all goes smoothly with the integration I’d like to get you talking to
Polymath sooner rather than later, so when would be good to set up a
call?

Polymath have so far raised these queries, which it would be great to
get some insight into:

1.       The original Olympic version of this app (which never went
live) was built using the CodeIgnitor framework, and we’re trying to
avoid using flash for accessibility purposes, so do you foresee any
problems using this?

2.       Confirmation that size should be the same as Torch relay app
700px x 500px

 Hope this makes sense, and I look forward to working on this!


Fiona McLaren

comments.value:

CodeIgniter requires PHP 5.1.6, which is installed on the london2012.com servers, so in principle this might be possible, but we do need a bit more information before we can give a definitive answer.
Would we be able to set up a call between you and Polymath in the middle of next week please?
Awaiting test files from Poymath.

Lives here..
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/paralympic-sport-selector.php (geo blocked)
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/paralympic-sport-selector/sorry.html 

Files and mock-up attached

The template should be similar to the one used for Torch (but in our usual branding) - it should have our usual header, and the 2nd/3rd columns combined to hold the app. In the first column we will need to place the Paralympic logo and the Lloyds TSB Proud Partner logo. I've attached Polymath's designs for clarity.
Latest zip attached

Slight update to URL - all pages now live in a /paralympic-sport-selector/ folder with the main page being the index.
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/paralympic-sport-selector/index.php (geo blocked)
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/paralympic-sport-selector/sorry.html

* the above folder is block from syncing form staging -> live (will need to remove this once we go live)
** also hide above pages from navigation / search

We created the new page but have noticed a few issues:

1: The tool tips slightly are off, suspect this is happening because the app is not living on the top left of the browser window

2: If you click on a sport a white pop-up box appears, i think this might be down to the cms converting all underscrores to hyphens so it wont find the image to display, probably best to resupply css/js with dashes in the paths

We have a current version on out staging server:
http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/get-involved/paralympic-sport-selector/index.php

Thanks,
Lars

Thanks for this - 

I'll pass those issues onto Polymath.

On the template front - the left hand nav was meant to be suppressed - and the left hand column should only have the Paralympic logo and the Lloyds TSB logos, as per the design. Can this change be made?

Thanks
Additionally, there shouldn't be a page title above the app (it currentaly says Paralympic ticket app)

Hi Fiona, can i have a picture of the Lloyds sponsors logo on the left side, i only have a pdf here which seems to have an incorrect "actual size" setting, so i'd look weird. 

Could you get me this please? 

I've hidden the navigation and removed the headline!

Thanks
Lars
Yep - attached - thanks!
Cheers, ok the Lloyds logo is now present.

Brilliant - looking good! 

Thanks for all your work on this
Jamie, make sure you add your days to the total before closing.

Building the page / template (Lars)
Multiple deployments (Jamie)
Email correspondence with LOCOG, BTS, Polymath  (Jamie)
Deployment for launch  (Jamie)
Post deployment debugging work  (Jamie)

comments.value: Create a Google Video sitemap

Hi Andy,

We've made some good progress on the video site map (only showing the first 20)
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/sitemap-videos.php

**Unfortunately before we can go live** we need to supply a path the the video stream itself (rather than just the page) and currently we only have a path to a config file http://players.mediafreedom.twofourdigital.net/locog/script/config.js?id=7aad6ef2-7b8a-4005-b0a2-9f1d00cd57b3

I'm going to fire an email over to eDialog to see if they can easily supply us with a url / string we can pass to Google (ie. a url we can tack that programme ID onto to get a direct url to the stream) and will cc you in. But you may need to chase up if I don't hear back from them as obviously I have no authority to ask them to do work (although I can't see why this would require any work other than a email response).

Jamie

See here if you interested in the details
http://www.google.com/support/webmasters/bin/answer.py?answer=80472

The values we need are as follows:

1) <video:content_loc>
You must specify at least one of <video:player_loc> or <video:content_loc>. The URL should point to a .mpg, .mpeg, .mp4, .m4v, .mov, .wmv, .asf, .avi, .ra, .ram, .rm, .flv, or other video file format, and can be omitted if <video:player_loc> is specified. However, because Google needs to be able to check that the Flash object is actually a player for video (as opposed to some other use of Flash, e.g. games and animations), it's helpful to provide both.

2) <video:player_loc>
At least one of <video:player_loc> or <video:content_loc> is required. A URL pointing to a Flash player for a specific video. In general, this is the information in the src element of an <embed> tag and should not be the same as the content of the <loc> tag. Since each video is uniquely identified by its content URL (the location of the actual video file) or, if a content URL is not present, a player URL (a URL pointing to a player for the video), you must include either the <video:player_loc> or <video:content_loc> tags. If these tags are omitted and we can't find this information, we'll be unable to index your video.
The optional attribute allow_embed specifies whether Google can embed the video in search results. Allowed values are Yes or No.
The optional attribute autoplay has a user-defined string (in the example above, ap=1) that Google may append (if appropriate) to the flashvars parameter to enable autoplay of the video. For example: <embed src="http://www.example.com/videoplayer.swf?video=123" autoplay="ap=1"/>.

Hi Andy,

Have spoken to TwoFour, here's an update:

Good news is we can get at the src video attribute (ie. the one we need to supply to Google) via the *new* TwoFour API 

We're currently migrating to the new API so I have asked Kieran to additionally pull this this parameter across as part of that work, we need to make an extra SOAP call to get this field and a few other changes, but it's nothing too onerous so we should be able to get those changes in place today.

So all we are waiting on now is the go ahead from Tom (Price Stephens) to switch over to the new API - I think Tom just wants to get 1 year to go out the way, before we swicth (in case anything goes wrong).

But as soon as we get the go ahead, we're ready to switch (to the new API) and in turn turn on the Video site map feed !

Jamie

Hi all. I've been covering this by telephone and will follow up this one with a call too, but wanted to update now as there's a small bit of work ready to be done ideally in the next couple of days.

The only request for an amend that I've had is this:

- The logo spaces in footers are currently 36x36 pixels. Please can we extend the width and height of those boxes proportionately to take advantage of the few spare pixels of white vertical space there is available in the footer space.

I've attached two examples to illustrate what I mean. 'footera' shows what a logo in the space looks like now. 'footerb' show what it would look like after this change. We'd just need to leave one or two rows worth of white pixel space above and below the logo space so that the tops and bottoms of logos don't touch the grey lines above and below them.

(Please note I'm not asking you to adjust any logos already published on sites, just to alter the space in footer include so we can do that ourselves with the next batch of sites).

Can you let me know that you've received this and that you'd be able to sort it in the next couple of days?

Ta in advance.

Finn

Hi Finn, can you resend the two examples? It looks like it will be relatively easy to change the spacing, but can you confirm that it is the intention to change the spacing for all logos and that the new versions are (or can be made) ready? Not sure if we can do it this week, but certainly next week.

Forgot to attach, oops. 

Thanks Danny. Ideally this week if at all possible.

OK. I think we need to get versions of all the logos to make sure that they will fit, but I think that the problem could be solved by using less whitespace around the logos. compare e.g. the VISA (no whitespace) and FIVB (too much whitespace) logos on http://www.londonpreparesseries.com/beachvolleyball.

I’ve tried to get logos provided from Sports Managers but have only had the one request and theirs is the logo in the one I’ve sent you. They were happy with that size.

This doesn’t necessarily mean that someone won’t panic two minutes before launch and yell ‘WE NEED A BIGGER LOGO SPACE!’ but they’ve had lots of opportunity to feed back and haven’t done and are aware of our timelines so they’ll have to stick with what they’ve got or wait for any future amendment requests to be delivered at a pace you / we are happy with.

Something I didn’t make clear perhaps is that I’m requesting that the default logo space size in the footer is always increased to whatever size you’re able to increase it to without spilling out of the footer. E.g. if we are able to move up from 36x36 to 45x45 then however many of those spaces we use (we can add more than one per footer using CMS) then they always default to 45x45. Any bigger logos with different dimensions are going to end up needing to be manual amends and static.
OK, Finn, I am marking this as pending for now.
Thanks Danny. Can you confirm this could be done by next Tues latest?
Please do create a new page using an existing template and add the sponsor logo of the required size. Once that is done, we will amend the div#footer.global .sponsors style, as required.

File structure for Gymnastics is now set up. I don’t seem to have admin rights to create includes from this account though.

(I think you did give me the admin account login at some point but...er...I’ve lost that as well :-/ If you want to send that account through again I can stop hassling you for this stuff :-) )
Finn, log back in and try again. I just amended the default role to allow the creation of includes.
Ta. Image is now in the footer, 55x55 pixels

Finn, the CSS has been amended but not yet published:
https://londonprepares.kitsite.com/kit/preview/gymnastics/index.html

But note the affect on existing pages:
https://londonprepares.kitsite.com/kit/preview/bmx/index.html

Could you confirm that this is what you want and we will go ahead and publish the CSS.

Hmm. That looks a lot worse than I’d hoped, to the point that people will make a stink at this end. There’s no alternative to reduce the white space below too. It’d be acceptable if you brought the black part of the footer up to be honest, I know we’d lose the remaining purple in the circles between the two sets of logos but that’d be better aesthetically than where we are now.

What d’you think?

The sponsors row appears to be fixed height. If we bring the black footer up for bmx it will obscure the gymnastics sponsor logo. I am sure we can resolve this problem--eventually, but it is likely to be less cost and trouble to re-do the logos so that they are consistent. Or I can revert to the way it was before and you can stick with the original smaller size.

Cool, looks like redoing the logos is the best option. However, I don’t want to publish the CSS just yet as I need to get the alternative logos prepped first and that’s unlikely to happen until midweek next week. Is that ok, does it take much doing once I tell you I’m ready?

Morning Danny / All

Let me know what you think about this this morning?

Hi Finn, in answer to your earlier question, it will take very little time to update and publish the CSS, so please do go ahead and get the new logos prepared. We should be able to preview and then publish them altogether once you are ready.
Grand, thanks Danny, will let you know when I’m ready. Likely to be tomorrow.

Hi Dan

I think I’m ready for you to apply this across the board so I can take a look at the effect it’ll have on all pages. Let me know when you can?

On a related note, when I alter the proportions of all the logos and repost them then theoretically I should just be increasing the depth of each logo by the amount you’ve removed from the padding to make them look more centred in the footer again? How many pixels did you remove in the end?
Hey Danny. Give me a shout ASAP when you’re ready to set this in motion?

Ready. 

Order of play:
- reload a logo (but don't republish)
- check it in preview
- if it looks ok, reload other logos
- publish logos and new CSS (we can do that together--you do the images, I will do the CSS)
- wait for akamai cache (not sure what the caching rules are on london prepares).

If in doubt at any stage call me.
Perfect, will get on to this now. Thanks Danny.
Working well, I’ll add all the logos and get back to you...
All done, pending republication of pages.

subject: Requested changes to CMS
description:
---------- Forwarded message ----------
From: Aaron Shone <Aaron.Shone@london2012.com>
Date: 7 June 2011 19:13
Subject: forthcomming CR raised
To: Danny Sofer <danny@kitsite.com>


Danny, as discussed, I have raised a CR to request the changes to the
Kitsite CMS. This is a heads up only, all changes should be managed by
Russ Ede as the operations manager...



Kitsite are requested to implement the following pre-agreed changes to
the CMS, following discussions as to appropriate remedial action.



1) Cross Site Request forgery: Functions that perform sensitive
actions should send the user a token as a hidden input field which is
unique to the users session. The token should be submitted with the
form and validated against the users session. Only requests that
induce a change in the application need to be subject to these
controls; for example, functions that update or delete data.



2) Information disclosure: Modify the web server configuration to
return a custom error page (specifically
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/servlet/upload and other referenced in
pen test report)

fix dev server to prohibit directory listings (given examples include
https://dev.kitsite.com/kit/admin/ and
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/admin/ but should be fixed at the
server configuration level to encompass the whole site



3) File upload abuse: remove php as an allowed type to be uploaded,
and confirm that this does not affect existing assets.



4) Session compromise : Ensure that the ‘HttpOnly’ and ‘Secure’ flags
are set on the JSESSIONID cookie.



5) disable HTTP trace method



Further to our meeting, can you provide a list of the current users,
roles  and level of access (constraints) to the LOCOG CMS, so we can
conduct a user access review and perhaps tweak users access privileges
to that which allows them to do their jobs and nothing more?



Also, could you investigate how difficult it would be to implement a
suit of password controls including complexity, length, age etc, or
alternatively, 2 factor authentication, to protect privileged
(publisher) access to the site?



Many thanks,



Aaron



Aaron Shone

IT Security Architect - Technology



Direct line:  +44 (0)30 2012 0605

Mobile:       +44 (0)77 6833 5894

subject: Sign-up form for Ceremonies - by 12 August
description:
As I warned Danny on Friday, we have a new sign-up form requirement... Sorry!

Our Ceremonies team are going to recruiting a small number of members of the public to be part of the Opening and Closing Ceremonies.

To do this they want to create a web-based form on london2012.com within the Ceremonies section www.london2012.com/ceremonies, probably in the Get involved sub-section http://www.london2012.com/games/ceremonies/get-involved/

Attached is the brief in terms of the fields they wish to capture. It's not complex in terms of data requirements - but the sting is the timeline, which isn't generous. The Ceremonies team need this form to be live on 12 August; it will stay open until the end of August.

This sign-up is different to our usual sign-ups though, as they want the registrations to be passed through to the Ceremonies technology team (using a secure process) so they can use the data to populate their own database i.e. the data doesn't go into our User Management System. The Ceremonies team will also handle all the confirmation emails - so we don't need to send anything out from our servers.

Danny sensibly queried on Friday whether this could not be done directly by eDialog, but I have checked and they don't have time to do this in the required timescale, bearing in mind that the ongoing migration for 1 September.

One of my questions around this was the scale of interest they were anticipating, and how they were planning to market it. Their interest is not to go out far and wide, and the launch will be soft rather than a big PR moment. Their aim is to acquire 15k users to invite to auditions, so we do not have to scale a huge solution. In theory.

Please could you review asap and let me know your thoughts? I'd then like to set up a call with Campbell McKilligan, the Ceremonies Head of Technology  - ideally for tomorrow morning.

Happy to answer questions in the meantime. In particular - I'd be interested in your thoughts on the achievability of the timeline.

Thank you!

Morag

Morag Reavley
New Media Manager
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games
1 Churchill Place
Canary Wharf
London
Direct dial: 020 32012 160
Reception: 020 32012 000

Jamie

As threatened earlier: the Ceremonies team have asked if possible you would be able to deliver the second stage of the casting process. This stage will involve:
1. Email sent to 15,000 people randomly selected from the Expressions of Interest sign up process which launches on 12 August (not in Kitsite scope)
2. This email sends them details on the next stage, plus a unique link to a semi-populated application form (using data already captured from them) (this is something Ceremonies would like Kitsite to deliver)
3. The form collects some additional data (see data doc attached) plus allows them to select in preference three audition dates randomly selected from a range (this is something Ceremonies would like Kitsite to deliver). Data is passed to the Ceremonies team as in the same way as the data from the 12 August sign up
4. The Ceremonies team allocates auditions to participants by email (not in Kitsite scope)
5. By January 2012 selected cast members will be able to login to a separate portal (built by the Ceremonies) which will allow them to see their details such as rehearsals (not in Kitsite scope)

In their brief (attached) they seem to be suggesting that users set a password which is encrypted

The timeline seems to me ridiculous, but suspending disbelief until I hear your thoughts. They want to get this live by the end of August. If they can't get the whole form with all the fields live by then, they would consider launching with some basic information plus audition selection and then inviting people to provide further information later (e.g. NI number, Passport, Previous addresses).

Their brief is not crystal clear, so might be best to do a quick call to run through it. Could we do this tomorrow morning?

Thank you...!
Thanks!

What is the timeline for this again?

Some questions / thoughts:

- Generating the unique link: I assume we can't just use a sequential ID or the users email address in the link, as those would be to easy to modify (and therefore edit someone else's profile). We could use some form of hash/checksum in the url but that would require that each email was seeded with a unique hash value, we'd also need to store that save hash value in our user DB. Probably need to thrash that out.

- Is "3.1.1 Functionality : Form can be saved at any point but cannot be submitted until completed" a requirement, it may be tricky to implement (using the current architecture).

- It's not totally clear but it looks as if this phase II form has fields that depend on previous questions, ie. 'What is your Nationality?' (If no Visa required go to 6.1) 'At Current Residential Address. If under 3 years go to'

Timescales aside, we could certainly handle this functionality with the current architecture. However the way we are implementing the first phase is not the ideal architecture if this is to grow into anything more complex ie. a user registration / management system. For a start the current architecture is very one way, with the front end communication to the CMS via XML API's. We normally just see User data being submitted from the front end to the CMS, rather than the inverse (the UMS is an exception to this rule). This may lead to features that may be easy to build in a different architecture/platform, actually being tricky to implement or ending up with us trying to "push round pegs in square holes".

I mention the above as if we were given more time, I would suggest a different approach / architecture for this kind of project (we'd probably suggest Rails). We haven't done that as I assume Ceremonies are about to go live with their own system built in Django (a perfectly sensible choice for something like this) and the bureaucracy involved in using or setting up another architecture is not worth imagining :-)

Happy to have a chat...

Jamie

Hi Morag

Apologies for the lateness, but we have been looking at this website - which seems to have changed over the course of the day which makes validating any tests even more difficult and time consuming.

1)            Cross-browser support - Opera CSS support

We tested on Firefox, Opera and Chrome, it look fine on Firefox and Opera but it is not rendering CSS in Opera - this is a known issue with Opera.

[cid:image001.png@01CC5848.A1196F30]

When you click on "View error details" it will popup errors messages, but if you click again then you would expect to hide errors again, but this is not happening.  Is this expected behaviour?

2)            Links testing - 404 error

If you click on FAQs link at top of the page and try to return by clicking on the link half way down the page: "To make an application for an audition slot please complete the online application form" you get a 404 error.

3)            Links testing - link to London2012 site now fixed?

At 13:40 it was observed that if you clicked on either of the following two links at the bottom of the page: "I have read and accept the Application Process and Terms and Conditions" - the link would send you to the London2012 home page.  Confirmation testing later in the afternoon showed the links going to the correct URL?

Apart from that the site looks okay.

subject: Paralympic competition schedule
description:
Okay, Olympic tickets are out of the way - now onto Paralympic tickets.... :-)

We want to create a replica version of the Olympic schedule http://www.london2012.com/games/olympic-sport-competition-schedule/index.php to sit on a separate page. Data will be supplied in a similar format.

With both schedules though, there are a number of upgrades we'd like to make - see the log attached. We would also like to adopt a few of the features from the Telegraph searchable schedule  at http://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/othersports/olympics/8288662/London-2012-Olympics-competition-schedule.html

The time for this is release in July (though we are announcing Paralympic ticket prices in mid-May). Just want to give you a heads-up so we can review the next steps - may be something we ask a design or usability agency to do some work on as well.

Hi,

The upgrades we'd like to make are in the previously attached 'feedback log' however here they are separately.

Dynamic dropdowns.  Limit choices available in dropdowns based on values already selected, e.g. only show 
Weymouth in venue dropdown if Sailing selected as sport.

Reset button.  Button to clear out all search criteria and display full list of events.

Hyperlinked sports and venues.  Link through to relevant pages on london2012.com.

Darker background colour.  Currently very difficult to see background colour of table and therefore cell delineators. 



Do get in touch if you have any questions,

Thanks

Hi guys - I think Jamie is picking this up.
Just to flag that as this will be launching in August we probably need to raise the priority of this now to get working on it,

Thanks,

Tom

Costs / spec attached.

Jamie
Awaiting sign off.

Agreed – we are just trying to get the csv file for you.

But yes we would like you to go ahead with the work.

Thanks,

Tom
Date to be confirmed asap but likely to be early August.
Due date: August 26.

Work in progress:

1) Data:
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/data/paracompetitionsessions

Notes:
- Venue drop down: is firstly to deal with long names in drop downs and secondly can be used to group venues (ie. Wimbledon court 1, 2 and 3 into 1 drop down option)
- If you add a entry you'll need to tie up the sports / venue pages manually
- Some Sports are missing fields (we are investigating) it may be worth holding off on manual amends till we fix as it may require a re-import (and hence all existing data will be lost).
- The rest should be fairly self explanatory

2) Search
http://locksley.london2012.com/games/olympic-sport-competition-schedule/paralympic-sport-competition-schedule.php

Notes:
- Still working on Venue -> Sports / Sports -> Venue drop down magic
- Contrast we have tried to tweak the contrast but if we make the background too dark the text become shard to read.

Hi Jamie,

Sorry I didn’t get a chance to look at this yesterday – this is still currently the Olympic schedule?

I may be confused was this something you hadn’t updated yet?

Thanks

Hi Tom,

I used the wrong templates to create the page, should be correct now.
http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/games/olympic-sport-competition-schedule/paralympic-sport-competition-schedule.php

The links to the sport/venue pages aren't showing up as we need to get them across into the front end index, which isn't happening yet (Kieran is working on it atm).

Still to drop in 'magic' drop downs for venue/sports.

Jamie

See separate invoice / pdf attached.

Paralympic schedule search
Creation of new Paralympic session data model	0.5
Parser / import of XLS data	2.0
Mapping Session venue names to drop-down / taxonomy values	1.0
Development of front end search form and results display	2.0
Development of backend search	1.0
Testing / Deployment	1.0
Total days	7.5

* Kieran actually spent extra time on several imports it and worked late on Thursday, so not sure if the above really covers it, but maybe best to keep to the agreed costs.
Complete.

We would like to be able to reuse the splash page originally developed by the ODA to  cover new venue launches - currently at https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/homepage-feature/index.php

We need to make a few changes:

1.       Breadcrumb currently says 'Social breadcrumb' - can we remove this element?

2.       'Explore more' box - how do we edit this? We don't have webcam or virtual tour but we do have video content - how do we remove one and change one to read 'Video'? How do we set up the links  to the right places from 'Photos' etc.?

Hi Morag,

Are the ODA still using this version, or will we have to create a new copy of it? We recently (well 3/4 months back) made some changes to it for Uzma/ODA.

It's not just a single templates but a set of pages/includes with fixed paths between them etc. so while it can be done if required, making a copy isn't trivial.

Obviously if the ODA are still using it then we'll have to make a copy, but thought I'd check first.

Most of the small changes seem fairly modest / doable.

The explore more box is semi hardcoded, they pull in 'includes' from a sub folder ( /homepage-feature/includes/ ) - I think it's clever enough that is you remove the includes the menu link goes as well (although if not we can just comment out the unused ones).

Jamie

Hi Jamie

Good question. The ODA aren’t still using the template, as it’s a home page template. Would any of the changes I’ve indicated be a major change to the template if they wanted to use it again? If so, we should probably copy it – but it’s obviously preferable not to.

Explore more – so if I delete the webcams include, that should remove it from the box? Shall I try that (or will I risk making a mess of it)?

And updating the main photo – does that just require me to reload the image?

Let me know which bits you need to do and which I can go ahead and tweak myself!

Thanks!

If the ODA aren't using any time soon then feel free to delete the include, we can always create a new one if needed.

Main photo, yes you can just reload the image.

Actually let me dig out the instructions I wrote for Uzma/Simon.

In terms of a new Include (outside the existing ones) that may be a little more complex/work, as we have a separate dedicated include for Videos, Webcams and Photos.

We can probably get the other bits done this week for you (Breadcrumb, Tickets, Countdown clock).

Splendid – thanks!

Instructions would be great before I plough in heavy-handedly!

Hello!

Forgot to follow up on this – were you able to look at this? We would like to be able to populate it on Tuesday.

Hi Morag,

It is pretty editable. If you’re replacing the current content:

1) Update the text 
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/pages/edit/homepage-feature/index.php

2) Update the background image (using reload in the browse interface)
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/homepage-feature/images/background-image.jpg

3) Edit each of the includes (in /includes) - but don't rename them
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/pages/edit/homepage-feature/includes/homepage-photos.php
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/pages/edit/homepage-feature/includes/homepage-webcams.php
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/pages/edit/homepage-feature/includes/homepage-videos.php
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/pages/edit/homepage-feature/includes/homepage-virtual-tours.php

Menus:
The news / blog menu appears / is suppressed, base don the meat data (I think their is a news.blog field)
The other menus are suppressed if the include is removed

*************************

Kitsite need to do / fix (Monday):

1. Breadcrumb currently says 'Social breadcrumb' - can we remove this element? [will look at why this is hapening today]
3. Tickets include - please can these be replaced with the Festival sign-up include?
4. Countdown clock is showing the wrong numbers - please can you update this? [will fix]

*************************

Morag,

See also previous comment,

I decided not to make a copy of this page due to the many (possible) dependencies and assume your not going to re-use it fro Velodrome (as you have already announced it). I hope this is OK. We can always re-instate the includes as required.

But I have now changed over the promo, the breadcrumb is now correct and the conter is correct (although only shows correctly once published)

Let me knwo if oyu need help on any other bits / when you need up to put this page live.

Jamie

This looks brilliant, thanks!

Is it possible to add in an include for ‘video’? There seem to be one in the CMS but it isn’t showing in preview.

This is great – my only query is how to enable the Videos include which is currently hidden.

We will want to put this page live at midnight tomorrow night – is it possible to set it up so I can do the swap myself using the magic splash page switching tool we used for Ticket sales the other week?

Hi Morag,

I was just going to say "you just need to assign it here"
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/pages/edit/homepage-feature/includes/homepage-videos.php

Although I notice it's setup for the old style big button videos.

Can I check what video you want to put here, as well need to re-jig it work work with TwoFour

Do you want it to work like the Blog (ie. you just add a lint into the relevant Video page)

Jamie

OK all realy now (I think)
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/homepage-feature/index.php

You need to add the url of the video page below into this page (I left a live one in for now so you can see it working)
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/pages/edit/homepage-feature/includes/homepage-videos.php

Jamie

ps. do we need to launch this splash page for you at some point or can you do it yourself now, I can't remember?

The new way to do it (removing the need to modify .htaccess). The reason for this new method is so that Morag/others can - if required - add/amend short-urls without accidentally enabling the homepage takeover ahead of time:

- Edit this page (http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/pages/edit/includes/homepage-takeover.php) in the CMS.
- There is a hyperlink container named "splashPage". Whatever this fragment links to will become the "splash page". i.e. you should use the "link" tool to pick the whatever page or asset you want the splash page to be. NB It can even be a link to an external website (just enter the url into the link picker).
- Once you've chosen the splash destination, save and publish includes/homepage-takeover.php.
- As soon as this page goes live, the homepage will redirect to the splash page.

- Removing: To remove the splash page redirect, edit the page again in the CMS (http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/pages/edit/includes/homepage-takeover.php) and use the (X) tool to remove the link assigned to the "splashPage" container. Publish includes/homepage-takeover.php. Once it is live, the homepage takeover will disappear.

[from "Staging environment" on our wiki]

This looks great, thank you.

I will endeavour to swap this over tonight just after midnight!
This has worked up to a point. But any nav links from the top nav back to home just take you to the old home page, not the new one.
Morag, we did not realise that this was a requirement. Do you want us to change this behaviour now?

It's not pulling through to the home page or the News archive - assume this is because we broke the normal association between English/French pages.

Could you advise a) how we fix this story and get it published on the French home page and News landing page and b) how we handle similar scenarios in future whereby we bypass the API translation route.

Subject: New homepage template chunk

Hi Lars,

I hope you're well.

I've just finished the HTML / CSS for the new "Sports at the London 2012 Games" section.

This work's a little easier than previous deliveries as there's no images needed!

Please find attached one file split into two sections:

CSS

subject: Selectively size video player depending on context
description:
3.       We now have the option of embedding the player at a larger size. The Twofour technical team have made changes to the player so it can be embedded at various sizes so we have two options for resizing to approx. 700px:
a)      If all embedded versions that you will use are the same size: TwoFour an change the MediaFreedom embed code generator so it generates all the embed codes in the larger size from now on.
b)      If we need different sizes in different places, you can manually edit the width and height properties in the generated embed code as you need to. 
I imagine option b) is our preferred one given that the size of the player in News/Blogs/Other templates is going to be 448px as currently. Can you advise so I can instruct TwoFour – then you can adapt the video template to accommodate a larger player.

Kitsite -> going to try and selectively change size of player and see if that is enough

Hi Pedro,

We don't have control of the map, it has it's own management interface built by Stamen (I don't know the url or have a login)

We just poll the Stamen's map server about new webcam pages and it adds them to the map, if you expire a page the CMS should one again poll the map server about that event and remove those pages (* however there is a slight exception to the rule in the case of the webcams, see below). 

I don't think Stamen respect the 'hide-from-navigation' checkbox or the 'disableWebcamTimelapse' checkbox, which are both in the XML view of the page they get back. I don't these values we're ever in use when we setup the map so it's certainly not an oversight on their part, although it may be wise to get them to add checks for these if they are looking at making any changes to the map. 

The IBC page seems up-to-date
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/webcams/international-broadcast-centre.php
http://www.siteeyelive.com/monitor/london2012/camputer87.jpg <--- source site eye url

So does Eaton Manor?
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/webcams/eton-manor.php
http://www.siteeyelive.com/monitor/london2012/camputer3.jpg <--- source site eye url

The Energy Centre seems to be out of date at Site-Eye's end
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/webcams/energy-centre.php
http://www.siteeyelive.com/monitor/london2012/camputer57.jpg <--- source site eye url


* one thing that complicates things slightly is the webcam feed is setup to auto generate the webcam page if it doesn't exist, so if you just go in via the CMS and remove a page then the feed will just re-create it. If you want to /completely remove/ any cameras (as opposed to just suppressing them) then let me know and I will modify the feed first (to remove them) and then when you delete them in the CMS they won't get re-created. I realise this may be what you are asking but due to the difference between suppression and deletion I just want to be sure. 


Jamie

Hi Jamie,
I have spoken to Russ about it. ODA is happy that those webcams should not be shown on the map. We have been monitoring the user’s activity for a long time now and those cameras are not that popular either. Therefore we request those webcams on the list to be completely removed from the feed and then deleted from CMS.
If any other issue should arise then contact me, please. We would appreciate if you just could update us when is done.
Regards
Pedro Martin
TSD Internet Operations Executive

Hi Jamie,

Have you been able to remove the webcams feed?
Do we have any progress on this?
Please, let us know when it is done.

Regards
Pedro

Sorry forgot to update you on this

Jamie

Hi Jamie,

Just realised the content of the original email  --> the map !

1/ Stamen had been calling the CMS via a http not a https API request (not their fault, as no one told them to update to https) and hence the request were failing, they are now updating this.

2/ We automatically call Stamen when a page is updated or deleted. But if you know the path of the page you want to poll them about, you can do it manually by altering this url as appropriate (it effectively prompts the map server to make another call back to the CMS to check if a new page has been added, update or deleted at the specified path).
http://data.map.london2012.com/kitsite-updates.php?path=webcams/eton-manor.php

3/ Or you can log directly into Stamens map management system, I don't have a login to that though.

Hi Jamie,
I have been checking the updates and like Confucius said:...”an image is worth more than a thousand words”...
This is what users find when they access the map (see attached document).
I don’t know if Stamen has to remove them or if the changes still need to be propagated via Akamai but it looks awful if we leave them like they are at the moment.

Regards

Pedro

Hi Pedro,

I can see the issue on the map, but I said we have no control over the map we simply make a call to data.map.london2012.com with the relevant path (see below) what happens after that is out of our hands.

> http://data.map.london2012.com/kitsite-updates.php?path=webcams/eton-manor.php

That said I know Danny was in a meeting with Stamen (and Russ?) last week and the outcome (I think) was that Stamen had been polling the CMS via http and not https which meant they weren't picking up the changes.

We have absolutely no control over the map, will simply load it into the page as a Flash file, so if you need to get changes made to it you are probably bets to talk to Stamen direct.

I know LOOCG did have a login to the map management systems, but I don't have those details.

Jamie

Hi Jamie,
Thanks again. I’ll update the incident and inform Russ about it.
Regards
Pedro
